New Records: Jos Buttler became England’s leading scorer in men’s T20Is
Jos Buttler brought up 50 in his 35th T20I match
Key Match Events: Jos Buttler hit a superbly-paced 73 off 47 balls
Sam Curran closed out the win with a superb spell at the death
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler chose to bat first on a used pitch
Adil Rashid has only taken one T20I wicket in six appearances
Moeen Ali takes the new ball for England, and there's spin immediately
England have a platform; now is the time for them to launch
Eoin Morgan is working for Sky Sports and expects this pitch - which has been used three times before - will spin
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sam Curran celebrated catching James Neesham
Chris Woakes conceded 20 runs in the 19th over of last year's semi-final, taken down by Daryl Mitchell as England were knocked out of the World Cup
Glenn Phillips picked up a googly and sent Adil Rashid over midwicket for a six
Others: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
This was the 33rd match in Group 1 of the T20 World Cup
